00045     def setUp(self):
00046         """
00047         As it's the first test, I will use this method as a simple TCB.
00048         I'm planning use some object to handle that.
00049         
00050         In this version, TCB is being initialized with test setup 
00051         values.
00052         
00053         Tcpdump file format would a form to store setup values.        
00054         """
00055         import random
00056         
00057         self.tcb = self
00058 
00059         #constants
00060         self.thisside = 0
00061         self.thatside = 1
00062         #...Can add other sides
00063         
00064         #opt 1 - this opt reduce the scalability, and bring more code.
00065         #self.ipsrc = pcs.inet_atol("192.168.1.10")
00066         #self.ipdst = pcs.inet_atol("192.168.1.20")
00067         #opt 2
00068         self.ip = { self.thisside : pcs.inet_atol("10.211.55.210") , \
00069                     self.thatside : pcs.inet_atol("10.211.55.220")}
00070 
00071         self.ipid = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1,(1<<16)-1) , \
00072                       self.thatside : 0}
00073 
00074 
00075         self.tcpport = { self.thisside : random.randrange(50000,60000) , \
00076                          self.thatside : 9}
00077 
00078         self.tcpsequence = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1,(1<<32)-1) , 
00079                              self.thatside : 0}
00080         
00081         # see TODO       
00082         self.ether = \
00083                 { self.thisside : ethernet.ether_atob("00:1c:42:9d:57:c9") , \
00084                   self.thatside : ethernet.ether_atob("00:1c:42:db:c5:22") }
00085 
00086 
00087         # see TODO       
00088         self.output = { self.thisside : pcs.PcapConnector("ed0") ,\
00089                         self.thatside : pcs.PcapConnector("ed0") }

00092     def testTestThreeWayHandshakeWithoutAnyOptions(self):
00093         """active open - three way handshake"""
00094         #RFC793-P31-p1
00095         #Reference to 3way handshake
00096         
00097     #
00098     #Sendind SYN
00099     #
00100         #THISSIDE
00101         (ipsyn, tcpsyn) = createsyn(self, self.tcb, self.tcb.thisside, \
00102                                                       self.tcb.thatside)
00103         createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipsyn, tcpsyn, self.tcb.thisside, \
00104                                                            self.tcb.thatside)
00105 
00106         #THATHSIDE
00107         #Receiving SYN (unfurtunately this time we are receiving from 
00108         #the same board) 
00109         (ipsynreceived, tcpsynreceived) = receive(self, self.tcb, self.tcb.thatside, \
00110                                                                     self.tcb.thisside)
00111 
00112         self.assertEqual(ipsyn, ipsynreceived)
00113         self.assertEqual(tcpsyn, tcpsynreceived)
00114         print tcpsynreceived 
00115 
00116 
00117     #
00118     #Receiving SYN+ACK
00119     #
00120         #THISSIDE
00121         #Receivinig SYN + ACK
00122         (ipsynack, tcpsynack) = receive(self, self.tcb, self.tcb.thisside, \
00123                                                            self.tcb.thatside) 
00124 
00125         #Some blackmagic to use assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK at SYN
00126         self.tcb.tcpsequence[ self.tcb.thatside ] = tcpsynack.sequence  
00127         assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, self.tcb, tcpsynack, \
00128                                         self.tcb.thisside, self.tcb.thatside)
00129 
00130         assertSynPresent(self, tcpsynack)
00131 
00132         #OK Its a SYN+ACK --> SYN consumes a sequence
00133         self.tcb.tcpsequence[ self.tcb.thatside ] = tcpsynack.sequence + 1
00134         print tcpsynack 
00135 
00136 
00137     #
00138     #Sending ACK
00139     #
00140         #THISSIDE
00141         (ipack, tcpack) = createip(self, self.tcb, self.tcb.thisside, \
00142                                                      self.tcb.thatside)
00143 
00144         createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipack, tcpack, self.tcb.thisside, \
00145                                                            self.tcb.thatside)
00146         print tcpack 
00147 
00148         #THATHSIDE
00149         #Receiving SYN (unfurtunately this time we are receiving from the same board) 
00150         (ipackreceived, tcpackreceived) = receive(self, self.tcb, self.tcb.thatside, \
00151                                                                     self.tcb.thisside)
00152         #Different values then 0 and 1 to tcpflags TODO
00153         #self.assertEqual(ipack, ipackreceived)
00154         #self.assertEqual(tcpack, tcpackreceived)
00155 
00156 
00157     #
00158     #Sending FIN
00159     #
00160         #THISSIDE
00161         (ipfin, tcpfin) = createfin(self, self.tcb, self.tcb.thisside, self.tcb.thatside)
00162         createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipfin, tcpfin, self.tcb.thisside, \
00163                                                            self.tcb.thatside)
00164         print tcpfin 
00165 
00166         #THATHSIDE
00167         #Receiving SYN (unfurtunately this time we are receiving from the same board) 
00168         (ipfinreceived, tcpfinreceived) = receive(self, self.tcb, self.tcb.thatside, \
00169                                                                     self.tcb.thisside)
00170         #Different values then 0 and 1 to tcpflags TODO
00171         #self.assertEqual(ipfin, ipfinreceived)
00172         #self.assertEqual(tcpfin, tcpfinreceived)
00173         
00174     #
00175     #Receiving ACK from FIN sent
00176     #
00177 
00178         #THISSIDE
00179         #Receiving ACK 
00180         (ipfinack, tcpfinack) = receive(self, self.tcb, self.tcb.thisside, self.tcb.thatside) 
00181         assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, self.tcb, tcpfinack, self.tcb.thisside, self.tcb.thatside)
00182 
00183         print tcpfinack 
00184 
00185     #
00186     #Receiving FIN
00187     #
00188         #test if FIN was sent in the same segment
00189         if (tcpfinack.fin == None or tcpfinack.fin == 0):
00190             
00191             #TODO same attribute used (ipfinack, tcpfinack)
00192             (ipfinack, tcpfinack) = receive(self, self.tcb, self.tcb.thisside,\
00193                                                               self.tcb.thatside)
00194             assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, self.tcb, tcpfinack, \
00195                                         self.tcb.thisside, self.tcb.thatside)
00196         
00197         assertFin(self, tcpfinack)
00198 
00199         print tcpfinack 
00200         
00201         #Fin consumes a sequence
00202         self.tcb.tcpsequence[ self.tcb.thatside ] += 1
00203              
00204     #
00205     #Sending ACK
00206     #
00207 
00208         #THISSIDE
00209         (ipackfin, tcpackfin) = createip(self, self.tcb, self.tcb.thisside, 
00210                                                            self.tcb.thatside)
00211         createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipackfin, tcpackfin, \
00212                                 self.tcb.thisside, self.tcb.thatside)
00213         print tcpackfin 
00214 
00215         #THATHSIDE
00216         #Receiving SYN (receiving from the same board) 
00217         (ipackfinreceived, tcpackfinreceived) = receive(self, self.tcb, \
00218                                         self.tcb.thatside, self.tcb.thisside) 
00219                                   
00220         #Different values then 0 and 1 to tcpflags TODO
00221         #self.assertEqual(ipackfin, ipackfinreceived)
00222         #self.assertEqual(tcpackfin, tcpackfinreceived)

00226 def assertAcknowledgmentPresent(self, tcp):
00227     """RFC??
00228        ...ack must be present in every packet since step #2 of 3wayhand
00229     """
00230     self.failIf(tcp.ack < 1)
00231     self.assertNotEqual(tcp.ack_number, 0)
00232     self.assertNotEqual(tcp.ack_number, None)
00233 
00234 def assertSynPresent(self, tcp):
00235     """
00236     """
00237     self.failIf(tcp.syn < 1)
00238     assertSequencePresent(self, tcp)
00239 
00240 def assertSequencePresent(self, tcp):
00241     """RFC793-P24-p1
00242        A fundamental notion in the design is that every octet of data sent
00243     over a TCP connection has a sequence number.
00244     """
00245     self.assertNotEqual(tcp.sequence, 0)
00246     self.assertNotEqual(tcp.sequence, None)
00247 
00248 def assertExpectedSequence(self, tcb, tcp, from_, to):
00249     """RFC??
00250     """
00251     self.assertEqual(tcp.sequence, tcb.tcpsequence[ to ])
00252 
00253 def assertExpectedAcknowledgment(self, tcb, tcp, from_, to):
00254     """RFC793-P16-p2
00255        Acknowledgment Number, value of the next sequence number the sender of
00256     the segment is expecting to receive
00257     """
00258     self.assertEqual(tcp.ack_number, tcb.tcpsequence[ from_ ])
00259 
00260 def assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, tcb, tcp, from_, to):
00261     
00262     #RFC793-P24-p1
00263     assertSequencePresent(self, tcp)
00264     #RFC TODO
00265     assertAcknowledgmentPresent(self, tcp)
00266     #RFC793-P16-p2
00267     assertExpectedAcknowledgment(self, tcb, tcp, from_, to)
00268     #RFC TODO
00269     assertExpectedSequence(self, tcb, tcp, from_, to)
00270 
00271 
00272 def assertFin(self, tcp):
00273     """is fin flag on?
00274     """
00275     self.failIf(tcp.fin<1)
00276

00278 def createsyn(self, tcb, from_, to):
00279     """Create tcp syn flag expertise"""
00280 
00281     (ip, tcp) = createip(self, tcb, from_, to)
00282 
00283     #business
00284     tcp.syn = 1
00285     tcp.ack = 0
00286     tcb.tcpsequence[ from_ ] += 1
00287 
00288     return (ip, tcp)
00289 
00290 def createfin(self, tcb, from_, to):
00291     """Create tcp fin flag expertise"""
00292 
00293     (ip, tcp) = createip(self, tcb, from_, to)
00294 
00295     #business
00296     tcp.fin = 1
00297     tcb.tcpsequence[ from_ ] += 1
00298 
00299     return (ip, tcp)
00300           
00301 def createip(self, tcb, from_, to):
00302     """Create ip packet
00303     tcp is also created here"""
00304     ip1 = ipv4.ipv4()
00305 
00306     ip1.version = 4 
00307     ip1.hlen = 5   
00308     ip1.tos = 0     
00309     ip1.id = tcb.ipid[ from_ ] 
00310     ip1.flags = 0 
00311     ip1.offset = 0
00312     ip1.ttl = 64
00313     ip1.protocol = pcs.IPPROTO_TCP
00314     ip1.src = tcb.ip[ from_ ]
00315     ip1.dst = tcb.ip[ to ]
00316     ip1.length = len(ip1.bytes)
00317 
00318     # tcp here
00319     tcp1 = createtcp(self, tcb, ip1, from_, to)
00320     
00321     ip1.length = len(ip1.bytes) + len(tcp1.bytes) 
00322     #ip1.checksum = ip_cksum(ip1) #doind this at checkout(createwritepacket)
00323     
00324     return (ip1, tcp1) 
00325 
00326 
00327 def createtcp(self, tcb, ip, from_, to):
00328     """Create tcp packet"""
00329     tcp1 = tcp.tcp()
00330 
00331     tcp1.sport = tcb.tcpport[ from_ ] 
00332     tcp1.dport = tcb.tcpport[ to ]
00333     tcp1.sequence = tcb.tcpsequence[ from_ ]        
00334     tcp1.ack_number = tcb.tcpsequence[ to ]
00335     tcp1.offset = 5
00336     tcp1.urgent = 0
00337     tcp1.ack = 1
00338     tcp1.push = 0
00339     tcp1.reset = 0
00340     tcp1.syn = 0
00341     tcp1.fin = 0
00342     tcp1.window = (1<<16)-1
00343     tcp1.urg_point = 0
00344     #tcp1.options
00345 
00346     #tcp1.checksum = tcp_cksum(tcp1 , ip) #doind this at checkout(createwrite)
00347 
00348     return tcp1
00349 
00350 
00351 def receive(self, tcb, from_, to):
00352     """receive packet for this socket
00353     This method must handle timmers"""
00354     (ip, tcp) = (None, None)
00355     while 1: 
00356         reply = tcb.output[ from_ ].read()
00357         try: 
00358             packet = ethernet.ethernet(reply)
00359             ip = packet.data
00360             tcp = ip.data
00361             if (tcb.ip[ from_ ]==ip.dst and \
00362                 tcb.ip[ to ]==ip.src and \
00363                 tcb.tcpport[ from_ ]==tcp.dport and \
00364                 tcb.tcpport[ to ]==tcp.sport): 
00365                 break
00366         except: 
00367             print "packet ignored"
00368             pass
00369         
00370     return (ip, tcp)
00371 
00372 
00373 def createethernet(self, tcb, from_, to):
00374     """Create ethernet header"""
00375     ether1 = ethernet.ethernet()
00376     ether1.src = tcb.ether[ from_ ]
00377     ether1.dst = tcb.ether[ to ]                
00378     ether1.type = 0x800
00379     
00380     return ether1
00381 
00382 
00383 def createwritepacket(self, tcb, ip, tcp, from_, to):
00384     ether = createethernet(self, tcb, from_, to)
00385 
00386     tcp.checksum = tcp_cksum(tcp , ip) 
00387 
00388     ip.length = len(ip.bytes) + len(tcp.bytes) 
00389     ip.checksum = ip_cksum(ip)
00390  
00391     packet = pcs.Chain([ ether, ip, tcp ])
00392     tcb.output[ from_ ].write(packet.bytes, len(packet.bytes))
00393   
00394 
00395 def tcp_cksum(self, ip, data = ""):  #TODO: add this method to pcs tcp.py
00396     """return tcpv4 checksum"""
00397     import struct
00398     total = 0
00399     
00400     tmpip = ipv4.pseudoipv4()
00401     tmpip.src = ip.src
00402     tmpip.dst = ip.dst
00403     tmpip.reserved = 0 
00404     tmpip.protocol = pcs.IPPROTO_TCP
00405     tmpip.length = len(self.getbytes()) + len(data)
00406     pkt = tmpip.getbytes() + self.getbytes() + data
00407     if len(pkt) % 2 == 1:
00408         pkt += "\0"
00409     for i in range(len(pkt)/2):
00410         total += (struct.unpack("!H", pkt[2*i:2*i+2])[0])
00411     total = (total >> 16) + (total & 0xffff)
00412     total += total >> 16
00413     return  ~total & 0xffff
00414     
00415 
00416 def ip_cksum(ip):    #TODO: solve the self problem, may be adding another arg
00417     """calculate the IPv4 checksum over a packet
00418     
00419     returns the calculated checksum
00420     """
00421     import struct
00422     total = 0
00423     packet = ipv4.ipv4(ip.bytes)
00424     packet.checksum = 0
00425     bytes = packet.bytes
00426     
00427     if len(bytes) % 2 == 1:
00428         bytes += "\0"
00429       
00430     for i in range(len(bytes)/2):
00431         total += (struct.unpack("!H", bytes[2*i:2*i+2])[0])
00432     
00433     total = (total >> 16) + (total & 0xffff)
00434     total += total >> 16
00435  
00436     return ~total & 0xffff
00437

00440     unittest.main()
